00022 /// @file   stats-distributions.h
00023 /// @brief  stats functions taken from perls Statistics::Distributions
00024 
00025 //! We want the output to be the same as the perl code, so
00026 //! we have converted the code to C. Refer to the perldocs
00027 //! for more info.
00028 
00029 //! These used to live in stats-distributions.cpp, but are now templates
00030 //! so we get the float and double versions.
00031 
00032 #ifndef __STATS_DISTRIBUTIONS_H_
00033 #define __STATS_DISTRIBUTIONS_H_
00034 
00035 #include "stats/statfun.h"
00036 //
00037 #include <cmath>
00038 //
00039 
00040 // avoids indenting all the functions.
00041 namespace affxstat {
00042   template <typename T1> T1 chisqrprob(int n,T1 x);
00043   template <typename T1> T1 uprob(T1 x);
00044   template <typename T1> T1 tDistribution(T1 x, T1 degFreedom);
00045   template <typename T1> T1 normalDistribution(T1 ecks, T1 mu, T1 sigma);
00046 }
00047 
00048 #define wunOverSqrtTwoPi 0.39894228040143270    
00049 
00050 
00051 #ifdef WIN32
00052 #define M_PI       3.14159265358979323846
00053 #endif
00054 
00055 /// @brief     The chi-squared probability
00056 /// @param     n         degrees of freedom
00057 /// @param     x         chi-square value
00058 /// @return    upper probability of the chi-square
00059 template <typename T1>
00060 T1
00061 affxstat::chisqrprob(int n,T1 x)
00062 {
00063   double p;
00064 
00065   if (x<=0) {
00066     p=1;
00067   } 
00068   else if (n>100) {
00069     p=uprob((pow((double)(x/n),(double)(1.0/3.0))
00070              -(1.0-2.0/9.0/n))/sqrt(((2.0/9.0)/n)));
00071   } 
00072   else if (x>400) {
00073     p=0;
00074   }
00075   else {  
00076     double a, i, i1;
00077     if ((n%2) != 0) {
00078       p=2.0*uprob(sqrt(x));
00079       a=sqrt((float)(2/M_PI))*exp(-x/2)/sqrt(x);
00080       i1=1;
00081     } 
00082     else {
00083       p=a=exp(-x/2.0);
00084       i1=2;
00085     }
00086     for (i=i1;i<=(n-2);i+=2) {
00087       a*=x/i;
00088       p+=a;
00089     }
00090   }
00091   return (T1)p;
00092 }
00093 
00094 /// @brief     upper probability of the u distribution (u=-0.85)
00095 /// @param     x         ???
00096 /// @return    0.0-1.0
00097 template <typename T1>
00098 T1
00099 affxstat::uprob(T1 x)
00100 {
00101   double p;
00102   double absx;
00103 
00104   p=0;
00105   absx=fabs(x);
00106 
00107   if (absx<1.9) {
00108     p=pow((1.0 +
00109            absx*(0.049867347
00110                  +absx*(0.0211410061
00111                         +absx*(0.0032776263
00112                                +absx*(0.0000380036
00113                                       +absx*(0.0000488906
00114                                              +absx*0.000005383)))))),-16)/2; // ?
00115   } 
00116   else if (absx<=100) {
00117     for (int i=18; i>=1;i--) {
00118       p=i/(absx+p);
00119     }
00120     p=exp(-0.5*absx*absx)
00121       / sqrt(2.0*M_PI)/(absx + p);
00122   }
00123 
00124   if (x<0) {
00125     p=1-p;
00126   }
00127   return (T1)p;
00128 }
00129 
00130 template <typename T1>
00131 T1
00132 affxstat::normalDistribution(T1 ecks, T1 mu, T1 sigma)
00133 {
00134   T1 temp1 = ((ecks - mu)/sigma); 
00135   //T1 temp2 = - (double)temp1 * (double)temp1;
00136   T1 temp2 = - temp1 * temp1;
00137   T1 temp3 = temp2/2.0; 
00138   T1 temp4 = exp(temp3);
00139 
00140 //  T1 temp5 = 1/((sqrt((2*M_PI))*sigma));  
00141   T1 temp5 = wunOverSqrtTwoPi * (1/sigma);  
00142 
00143   T1 temp6 = temp5 * temp4;
00144 
00145   return temp6;
00146 
00147 }

00150  
00151 template <typename T1>
00152 T1
00153 affxstat::tDistribution(T1 x, T1 degFreedom)
00154 {
00155   T1 temp1 = gammln( ((degFreedom+1)/2) );
00156   T1 temp2 = gammln( degFreedom/2 );
00157 
00158   T1 temp3 = (degFreedom * M_PI);
00159      temp3 = pow(temp3, 0.5);
00160      temp3 = log(temp3);
00161 
00162   T1 temp4 = 1 + ( ((x * x) / degFreedom) );
00163      temp4 = log(temp4);
00164   T1 temp5 = -(degFreedom + 1.0)/2.0;
00165   T1 temp6 = temp4 * temp5; 
00166 
00167   T1 temp7 = temp1 - temp2 -temp3 + temp6;
00168 
00169   T1 output = exp(temp7);
00170 
00171   return output;
00172 }
